scheme_name: Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
description: A flagship scheme of the Government of India to provide health coverage of Rs. 5 lakhs per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization to over 12 crore poor and vulnerable families.
eligibility_criteria: Families identified as poor and vulnerable based on the Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) 2011 for rural and urban areas. All families previously covered by Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY) are also included.
documents_required: Aadhaar Card, Ration Card, PM-JAY e-card (if available), and a government-certified ID.
application_steps: No specific application is needed for eligible beneficiaries as they are identified from the SECC database. Beneficiaries can get their PM-JAY e-card from a Common Service Center (CSC) or an empaneled hospital.

description: An income support scheme where all small and marginal farmer families get up to ₹6,000 per year in three installments. This money can be used for procuring inputs for agriculture and allied activities as well as for domestic needs.
eligibility_criteria: All landholding farmer families in the country are eligible, subject to certain exclusion criteria related to higher income status.
documents_required: Aadhaar card, Citizenship certificate, Landholding papers, Bank account details.
application_steps: Farmers can register through the official PM-KISAN portal (pmkisan.gov.in), through Common Service Centers (CSCs), or via the state-designated nodal officers.

description: A scheme to provide loans up to ₹10 lakh to non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises. Loans are given by Commercial Banks, RRBs, Small Finance Banks, MFIs and NBFCs.
eligibility_criteria: Any Indian Citizen who has a business plan for a non-farm sector income generating activity such as manufacturing, processing, trading or service sector and whose credit need is less than ₹10 lakh.
documents_required: Proof of identity, Proof of address, Business plan, Application form, and other documents as required by the lending institution.
application_steps: 1. Approach a nearby branch of a bank or financial institution. 2. Submit the business plan and application form (available online). 3. Complete the loan formalities as per the lender's instructions.
